title: Phacelia calthifolia
text:
Phacelia calthifolia (calthaleaf phacelia or caltha-leaved phacelia), is a <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a> in the family <a href="Boraginaceae">Boraginaceae</a>. It is native to the <a href="Mojave%20Desert">Mojave Desert</a> in southeastern <a href="California">California</a> and western <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>, between <a href="Barstow%2C%20California">Barstow, California</a>, and the <a href="Death%20Valley">Death Valley</a> area, where it occurs below 1,000 m in sandy soils.
It is an <a href="annual%20plant">annual plant</a> growing to 30 cm tall, with bristly stems. The <a href="leaf">leaves</a> are dark green, rounded to heart-shaped with a notched base, 1–3 cm long and wide, with an entire or serrated margin. The <a href="flower">flower</a>s are bell-shaped, about 1 cm diameter, <a href="purple">purple</a> to <a href="Violet%20%28color%29">violet</a> in color.
